general_advisory: As per the extended range forecast, dry weather is very likely to prevail over the districts of Odisha. Farmers are advised to provide one live saving irrigation in standing crop, conduct all kinds of spraying and intercultural operations during the specified period in morning or evening hours.

advisory: In transplanted rice, application of 35 kg urea per acre should be advised as first top dressing at 20-25 days after transplanting or maximum tillering stage.
Insect/Pest management: In just transplanted field, use pheromone traps for monitoring yellow stem borer and leaf folder. Spray Azadiractin neem seed kernel based EC formulation if necessary.
Use yellow sticky traps to control sucking insect attack in Green/Black gram field.
To control yellow mosaic virus attack, spray imidacloprid or thiamethoxam per liter of water.
Use yellow sticky traps to control sucking insect attack in Green/Black gram field.
To control yellow mosaic virus attack, spray imidacloprid or thiamethoxam per liter of water.
Regularly monitor Mango Hopper attack in orchard.
Avoid irrigation at flowering stage to reduce flower drop in Mango orchard.
To control leaf eating caterpillar and fruit borer/shoot and fruit borer in Tomato and Brinjal, spray Emamectin Benzoate per liter of water.
Regular monitoring against sucking insect attack. Avoid chemical application at flowering stage.
Increase fresh clean drinking water supply to animals due to rising temperature.
Vaccination against certain diseases and deworming of animals is advised.
